alert.note: Alert for Hillsborough; Rockingham (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 11 at 6:37PM EDT until September 11 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN HILLSBOROUGH AND SOUTHWESTERN ROCKINGHAM COUNTIES... At 637 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 2 to 3 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Nashua, Derry, Merrimack, Salem, Amherst, Litchfield, Hollis and Mason. This includes Interstate 93 between mile markers 5 and 14. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...2-3 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Life Threatening flooding is occurring. Take action NOW to move to higher ground! If trapped, do not attempt to cross fast moving water. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
